data.title: Emily Yong Beck
data.text:
Gaa Gallery New York is pleased to present Same As It Ever Was, a solo exhibition by Emily Yong Beck. This is the artist’s first solo show in New York. On view through December 9, Same As it Ever Was will open with a reception on Friday, October 27, from 6 - 8 pm at 4 Cortlandt Alley.

For the 2022 edition of Untitled Art, Miami Beach, Gaa Gallery is pleased to present new works by New York-based painter Elizabeth Tibbetts and Chicago-based artists Juan Arango Palacios and Emily Yong Beck. The fair runs November 28 through December 3, with an opening preview (by invitation only) Monday, November 28, from 1 - 8 pm and public days Tuesday, November 29 through Saturday, December 3, from 11 am - 7 pm. The fair will take place at Ocean Drive and 12th Street, Miami Beach, Florida.

Please stop by to see us, and we look forward to welcoming to Booth B12!

Gaa Gallery is pleased to present Lions & Lambs, a solo exhibition of ceramic sculptures by Chicago-based artist, Emily Yong Beck. Juxtaposing propaganda cartoons and reinterpretations of European and Asian ceramics, Lions & Lambs is a rigorous and aesthetically expansive examination of cuteness culture. This will be Yong Beck's first solo exhibition with the gallery and will run through August 28, with an opening reception on Friday, August 5, from 6 - 8 pm.

For the 2022 edition of NADA New York, Gaa Gallery is pleased to exhibit new works by Kaylie Kaitschuck and Emily Yong Beck. In pairing Kaitschuck’s yarn and felt embroideries and Yong Beck’s hand-built ceramic sculptures, this presentation engages a tactile and maximal dialogue on the intersections of craft, humor, identity, and culture. Please join us May 5–8 at Pier 36 - 299 South St, New York, NY 10002.
